description: Primes of form 8k+5 generated recursively: a(1)=5, a(n) = least prime p = 5 mod 8 with p|4+Q^2, where Q is the product of all previous terms in the sequence.
references: G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, page 13.
links: P. G. L. Dirichlet, Supplement VI: Beweis des Satzes, dass jede unbegrenzte arithmetische Progression, deren erstes Glied und Differenz ganze Zahlen ohne gemeinschaftlichen Factor sind, unendlich viele Primzahlen enth√§lt, Vorlesungen uber Zahlentheorie. Braunschweig, Viewig, 1871, 24 pages.
example: a(3)=1237=8*154+5 is the smallest suitable prime divisor of (5.29)*5.29+4 = 21029 = 17*1237. Albeit 17 is the smallest prime divisor, but 17 is not congruent to 5 modulo 8, so 1237 is the good choice.
prog: (PARI) lista(nn) = {v = vector(nn); v[1] = 5; print1(v[1], ", "); for (n=2, nn, f = factor(4 + prod(k=1, n-1, v[k])^2); for (k=1, #f~, if (f[k, 1] % 8 == 5, v[n] = f[k,1]; break);); print1(v[n], ", "););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 27 2014
author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 09 2000
extensions: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Oct 26 2014
